New Records: Rohit Sharma (4165) vaulted past Virat Kohli (4103) to the top of the run-scoring leaderboard in T20Is
Key Match Events: England was bowled out for 103 runs in 16.4 overs
Pre-Game Insights: India are unbeaten in the T20 World Cup 2024
England have got to the semi-final with some hiccups
The match promises to be compelling whatever comes to pass
Post-Match Reflections: India captain Rohit Sharma said 'Wherever we play, whether it's bilateral series or ICC tournaments, the Indian cricket team is always under pressure. That's the fact. Most of the guys are used to it, so it's important to have a little bit of calmness in the dressing room.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Spin has been a significant weapon at Providence in this tournament, with 27 wickets falling in five previous matches, at a strike-rate of 17.1
A minimum of 10 overs per side will be required to constitute a match
Others: India still boast a positive overall head-to-head against England in T20Is, with 12 wins and 11 losses in their previous 23 encounters
